items.title: Bitcoin jumps over 2% to $92,200 as crypto markets gain on renewed risk appetite
items.summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum are showing positive momentum, with Bitcoin nearing $92,300 and Ethereum at $3,242, buoyed by recovering risk appetite and regional equities. Spot ETF activity suggests institutional demand is stabilizing. Analysts anticipate Bitcoin could target $100,000 with a close above $94,140, while Ethereum eyes a breakout above $3,350.

items.title: India CPI Retail Inflation Live: India’s CPI inflation to climb in November, FY26 average expected at 2%
items.summary: CPI Retail Inflation live updates: Retail inflation in India may rise to 0.5–1% in November due to fading base effects and higher gold and silver prices. Core CPI stays steady. RBI cuts FY26 forecast to 2%, while FY27 inflation could rebound to 4%.

items.title: MTR-owner Orkla India eyes deals, bets on quick meals and delivery for growth
items.summary: As consumer demand for convenience foods surges, Orkla India plans strategic acquisitions and leverages the rapid growth of e-commerce and delivery services to revitalise its market presence

items.title: MTR-owner Orkla India eyes deals, bets on quick meals and delivery for growth
items.summary: The Indian arm of Norwegian consumer goods group Orkla, which merged MTR and Eastern in 2023, expects to return to its historical double-digit revenue growth in fiscal 2026 and beyond. It last reported such a rise in fiscal 2023.

items.title: Delhi HC allows Dr. Reddy’s to export weight-loss drug semaglutide, calls Novo Nordisk’s case ‘weak’
items.summary: The Delhi High Court declined to stay a single-judge order allowing Dr. Reddy's to export its semaglutide, observing Novo Nordisk's appeal presented a weak case. This decision permits Dr. Reddy's to supply the drug to countries without Novo Nordisk's patent protection, while the broader legal dispute over intellectual property continues.

items.title: Mexico Parliament nod to tariffs on India, others prompts FTA push by exporters
items.summary: Mexico will impose significant tariffs on imports from countries like India starting January 1, 2026. This move could impact India's annual shipments worth $5.75 billion. Tariffs will range from 5-50% on over 1,400 products. Indian exporters are concerned about competitiveness and are pushing for a trade deal with Mexico. This could also help bypass US tariffs.

items.title: India bonds dip before debt sale, domestic CPI data
items.summary: Indian government bonds faced pressure early Friday. Investors braced for a large debt sale and awaited the nation's inflation figures. The benchmark 10-year yield saw an increase. The Reserve Bank of India's bond purchases provided some support. The rupee also hit a record low against the dollar. Market direction hinges on the auction results and inflation data.

items.title: India frees up visas for Chinese professionals in key step to boost ties
items.summary: New Delhi drops extra vetting layer, cutting approval times to under a month in bid to revive business ties and curb production losses

items.title: India’s maritime sector at inflection point: A structural opportunity unfolds
items.summary: India’s maritime sector is entering a structural growth phase, supported by ambitious national visions, strong policy incentives, rising demand aggregation, and expanding shipbuilding and port capacity. As global trade shifts toward Asia and greener vessels, India is positioned to emerge as a major maritime power over the coming decades.

items.title: Four DGCA inspectors terminated after IndiGo’s meltdown
items.summary: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation has fired four inspectors. These inspectors were responsible for checking IndiGo's readiness for new pilot rest rules. IndiGo faced major flight cancellations due to pilot shortages. This action raises questions about the regulator's oversight. The government has also directed IndiGo to reduce flights.

items.title: DGCA terminates 4 IndiGo officials responsible for overseeing airline safety & ops
items.summary: IndiGo faces continued challenges as aviation regulators terminated four inspectors. This follows intensified scrutiny of the airline's operations. IndiGo CEO underwent an inquiry panel. The airline announced compensation for affected passengers. Over 200 flights were cancelled at Delhi and Bangalore airports. The civil aviation ministry directed IndiGo to reduce its winter schedule.

items.title: Why global diversification is becoming essential for modern investors
items.summary: As investment boundaries fade, global diversification has become essential for long-term wealth creation, especially for investors in emerging markets like India. Spreading investments across geographies reduces dependence on a single economy, offers currency gains, provides access to global innovation, lowers volatility, and opens exposure to sectors underrepresented in domestic markets.

items.title: GMDC shares jump 7% on Odisha coal mine project development, awards operating contract

This move follows the acquisition of forest and environmental clearances. The development marks a key step in GMDC's coal sector expansion. The company is focused on building a diversified mining business.

The brokerage highlights companies expected to benefit from sustained demand and market formalization.

items.title: India frees up visas for Chinese professionals in key step to boost ties
items.summary: India is now issuing Chinese business visas within a month. This move aims to boost ties with China and end significant output losses. Bureaucratic hurdles have been removed, speeding up approvals. This decision follows Prime Minister Narendra Modi's efforts to improve the business environment for foreign investors. The change is expected to help Indian electronics makers and other industries.

items.title: What rising long-end yields signal for fixed-income investors in 2026
items.summary: Long-end bond yields rose in November despite RBI’s OMO purchases, driven by a demand–supply mismatch and stronger-than-expected GDP growth. The yield curve steepened sharply as markets priced out a near-term rate cut. With inflation undershooting forecasts, investors may see range-bound yields ahead, with the 10-year expected at 6.35–6.65%.

items.title: RBI eases restrictions on cash credit accounts, eases current account norms
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has lifted all restrictions on banks opening and maintaining cash credit accounts, offering greater flexibility for short-term working capital loans. Additionally, the central bank eased norms for current and overdraft accounts, allowing banks to maintain them without restriction for customers with exposures under 100 million rupees.

items.title: Budweiser ties up with ICC in AB InBev's first cricket outing with a 2-year sponsorship contract
items.summary: Budweiser will be the official sponsor for ICC's tournaments for the next two years. This is the first association with cricket for the world's largest beer maker.

items.title: Nippon Large Cap Fund crosses ₹50,000 crore in AUM
items.summary: The surge in AUM comes even as the flows into large-cap funds have softened in the last few months due to profit booking after the recent market rally and the impact of liquidity needs which arise during the festival season

items.title: SAT stays Sebi order barring Prabhudas Lilladher from new business
items.summary: The Securities Appellate Tribunal has temporarily halted a Sebi order preventing Prabhudas Lilladher from new business for seven days. Sebi has six weeks to reply to the appeal, with the next hearing slated for March 23, 2026.

items.title: Jindal Steel triples heat-treated plate capacity to 7 lakh tonnes annually
items.summary: Jindal Steel has significantly expanded its heat-treated plate capacity. The company's annual capacity has tripled to seven lakh tonnes. This move strengthens its offerings in high-strength, abrasion-resistant, and defense-grade plates. The enhanced capabilities support India's manufacturing goals and export potential. Jindal Steel also plans infrastructure development to improve its supply chain efficiency.

items.title: Accel’s Prashanth Prakash joins WTFund as strategic advisor; fund unveils new cohort of Under-25 start-ups
items.summary: The newly announced C1/25 cohort spans AI, health tech, security, electronics manufacturing, and biomedical innovation, underscoring the fund’s focus on young founders solving real-world problems

items.title: Prada signs MoU to sell Kohlapuris at India-Italy forum
items.summary: Earlier in June this year, Prada faced criticism for leather sandals in its Spring/Summer 2026 collection, which closely resembled Kolhapuri Chappal

items.title: AMFI expects inflows to cross ₹8 lakh crore next year
items.summary: Equity inflows in November jump 21 per cent to ₹29,911 crore

items.title: IndiGo boss Pieter Elbers asked to appear before DGCA on December 12
items.summary: IndiGo CEO Pieter Elbers has been summoned by the DGCA on December 12, 2025, to address severe operational disruptions, including widespread flight cancellations and crew issues. The airline's pilot strength has significantly dropped, prompting the DGCA to deploy officers to its headquarters to monitor operations amid criticism from pilots' bodies regarding the airline's manpower strategy.

items.title: Amazon expands India push with Govt tie-ups for artisans, women-led enterprises and more — full details
items.summary: Amazon Inc. partners with government institutions to uplift traditional artisans and women-led startups, aiming to enhance market access and sustainability. This collaboration promises significant job creation, reinforcing Amazon's commitment to India's economic development, the company said.

items.title: 'Never negotiate with deadlines as you can make mistakes': Piyush Goyal on India-US trade talks
items.summary: India's trade talks with the United States are moving forward positively. Union Minister Piyush Goyal met with US Deputy Trade Representative Rick Switzer. Discussions have been substantive over multiple rounds. Switzer's visit marks his first trip to India. Goyal emphasized that any agreement must benefit both countries. He also noted that setting deadlines can lead to errors in negotiations.

items.title: GCC surge to reshape India’s IT and office leasing market as revenue hits $64.6 billion
items.summary: India's Global Capability Centres are growing rapidly, moving beyond back-office tasks to become innovation hubs. This trend is boosting the country's IT sector and increasing demand for prime office spaces. GCCs are employing more professionals and are projected to significantly contribute to office leasing. Government policies are supporting this expansion, making India a key destination for global tech operations.

items.title: Oman's lower house approves trade pact with India; Union cabinet may take up on Fri
items.summary: India's free trade agreement with Oman is moving forward. Oman's Shura Council has approved the pact. India's Union Cabinet is expected to review it soon. This agreement aims to boost trade in goods and services. It will reduce or eliminate customs duties on many products. India's exports to Oman are set to benefit significantly.

items.title: Watch: Indian rice exporters not worried about US’s high tariff threats
items.summary: Indian rice exporters remain unfazed after the United States threatened to impose higher tariffs on Indian rice. Exporters say the move is unlikely to affect their business, as shipments to the US make up only a tiny fraction of India’s overall rice exports. However, rice growers in Haryana feel that higher tariff by US would make them competitive weaker in the global market at a time when farmers in any case were facing a lot of problems.

items.title: India’s beverage carton recycling jumps to 48%, beats global average
items.summary: A recent study shows India's recycling rate for food and beverage cartons has risen to 48%, significantly higher than the global average of 27%. This achievement results from combined efforts in sustainability, education, and innovative technology in the recycling sector.

items.title: Finance Ministry streamlines recruitment, result cycle for public sector banks
items.summary: This includes recruitment to SBI, Nationalised Banks and Regional Rural Banks

items.title: India’s first indigenous hydrogen fuel cell passenger vessel enters commercial service in Varanasi
items.summary: India's first indigenous hydrogen fuel cell passenger vessel has commenced commercial operations in Varanasi, marking a significant step in sustainable maritime transport. This vessel, powered by a Low Temperature Proton Exchange Membrane fuel cell system, releases only water as a byproduct, contributing to the rejuvenation of the Ganga River.

items.title: IndiGo flight crisis: DGCA officials start monitoring operations, refunds at airline headquarters
items.summary: DGCA officials are now monitoring IndiGo's operations directly from its headquarters. This move follows significant flight cancellations due to planning failures. The regulator is scrutinizing cancellations, crew deployment, and passenger refunds. On-site inspections at airports are also underway. IndiGo, a major airline, has cancelled thousands of flights, impacting many passengers. The airline states its operations are stabilizing.

items.title: International Cricket Council signs AB InBev as global sponsor
items.summary: The International Cricket Council (ICC) has partnered with AB InBev, the world's largest brewer, for a multi-year sponsorship deal starting in 2026. Budweiser 0.0 will lead the activation in India, with other AB InBev brands engaging fans globally. This collaboration aims to enhance fan experiences and create celebratory moments for cricket enthusiasts of legal drinking age.

items.title: Samsung to make more in India for the world in next decade
items.summary: Samsung has completed 30 years of operations in India and the company said it is the only brand in the country with an end-to-end AI ecosystem with smartphones, tablets, refrigerators, washing machines, televisions and smart monitors together.

items.title: Prada to launch $930 ‘Made in India’ sandals after backlash
items.summary: The collection will go on sale in February 2026 across 40 Prada stores worldwide and online.

items.title: Inside the UPI decade: How a cash-first nation learned to pay differently
items.summary: UPI’s rise reflects a deeper behavioural shift in how routine payment activity is conducted across the country. However, its reach, though expanding, remains uneven. In addition, the system is attracting attention from bad actors. Here’s what a study across two Indian states found:

items.summary: Naxion Energy launches advanced sodium-ion energy storage systems, offering reliable, long-lasting power solutions for various sectors.

items.title: IndiGo Meltdown: India must have at least five airlines with 100 aircraft each to avoid such crises, says aviation minister

This move aims to prevent future aviation crises and reduce passenger dependence on a few dominant carriers. The minister pointed to IndiGo's recent operational failures as a structural warning.

A new sequence will see SBI results announced first, followed by Nationalised Banks, and then Regional Rural Banks, aiming to reduce attrition and improve workforce planning.

items.title: Mint Explainer | What drove China’s trillion-dollar trade surplus—and why it matters
items.summary: Despite a deepening domestic slowdown, Beijing’s factories are flooding world markets with ultra-cheap goods, pushing its trade surplus past $1 trillion and intensifying pressure on India and other economies.

items.title: What the IndiGo fiasco tells us: The role played by the state is being taken over by mega corporations
items.summary: When switching costs turn prohibitive for consumers, loyalty is the same as captivity. India needs big businesses, no doubt, but we should be able to walk away from them painlessly if we want. We need value-delivering corporations, not monopolies we can’t do without.

items.title: Flaky utopia: Musk’s dream of technology freeing the world of work and poverty needs a reality check

items.summary: Car registrations barely grew between January and September 2025, compared to the same period last year. But a turnaround in October and an unusually strong November suggest a recovery may be taking hold.

items.summary: The success of films like Tere Ishk Mein illustrates that audience engagement often outweighs critical reviews. Strong emotional narratives and catchy music attract viewers, particularly in regions where social media influence is less pronounced, highlighting a shift in cinema consumption patterns.

While merchandise exports are facing headwinds from tariff challenges, the services sector shines brightly, bolstering the nation's economic stability. Analysts anticipate that the current account deficit will stay within a bearable range. Despite a dip in some exports to the US, other sectors are thriving.

items.title: The government must act as a model employer to demonstrate its commitment to India’s labour codes
items.summary: Now that India has announced the implementation of its labour codes , government sincerity on worker welfare will be tested. The state can begin by granting all its employees social security, minimum wages and other long-overdue benefits.

items.title: Budget 2017-18: Pro-poor, pro-rural, pro-reform; first after DeMo, first to feature Railways
items.summary: Budget 2017-18 brought in significant fiscal changes. It focused on tax reforms, rural development and infrastructure growth. The budget aimed to boost digitisation and reassure demonetisation-haunted citizens. Key initiatives included income tax relief for lower earners and record allocations for agriculture and rural sectors. Infra spending saw big increase, with a focus on transport and railways.

items.summary: Union Budget 2016-17 prioritised rural development, farmers and infrastructure. Arun Jaitley announced significant allocations for agriculture, rural welfare and connectivity. The budget aimed to double farmers' incomes and boost rural electrification. Infrastructure got a substantial push, with a focus on road development. Reforms in finance and tax proposals were also among key highlights.

items.title: Fed rate cut boosts sentiment, yet India’s policy and rupee to stay domestically driven
items.summary: While Fed rate cuts ease global liquidity and market pressures, India’s policy decisions and rupee stability continue to be driven by domestic economic conditions.

items.title: One of running’s great unsung gifts: The unexpected kindness of strangers

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
